column4: trying to burn an audio cd in graveman, im getting "Can't open input file '(null)': No such file or directory". any ideas to solve this?
when running "mount /dev/cdrom" im getting mount: block device /dev/hdc is write-protected, mounting read-only
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hdc,
cat you give me the output of cat /etc/fstab | grep cdrom
/dev/hdc        /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto     0       0
can you take the cdrom out of your cdrom-drive, put it back in and then give me the output of dmesg | tail -n 5
[4297388.178000]  cdrom: This disc doesn't have any tracks I recognize!
are you sure the cdrom in your drive is a good cd with no errors?
its a blank cd, but give me a sec ill try another
of course you can't mount a blank cd
oh, sorry, i thought you had to mount before you could burn to it, because graveman is giving errors
no you don't need to mount it before burning
for example if you'd like to burn an iso image, you could try this:
well, best thing to do to check whether your drive is working in ubuntu or not, is to use the cdrecord tool. But it's not as easy as using a user interface

i get " Can't open input file '(null)': No such file or directory" from graveman, i know the cd drive works, ive used it before to burn a data cd, athough i might have changed some settings or something since then
sounds like a bug in graveman
:D, i dont suppose you can recommend any other UIs that dont have any gnome/kde dependencies?
in ubuntu, can't you simply use the nautilus trick? bruning cd's is integrated
im using xubuntu, so no nautilus
:O
but it does work ..
man cdrecord :)
